title: Here's Why Bank Stocks Are Set to Rise Dramatically - TheStreet
text:
Reddit Email Print Reprint Although many investors focus on high-profile areas of the market, the financial sector has been largely overlooked, as everyone seems to be obsessed with the interest rate soap opera. Will the Federal Reserve raise interest rates or not? What effect could it have on banks?
This is exactly why this could be the time to put some money into the banking sector. Going against the herd, in general, is always a good thing, because the crowd is notorious for being on the wrong side of the market.
Additionally, every balanced portfolio should have some money allocated to financial stocks. Of course, many investors are angry at the big banks after the financial crisis, and for good reason. But take a tip from the annals of mass psychology: Do not let your emotions get in the way, because the market does not reward emotional junkies.

Some observers are positing that just because Citigroup ( C - Get Report ) and Deutsche Bank ( DB - Get Report ) are trading below their pre-2008 highs, it is a sign that the markets will take the same path and crash. This is hogwash. Both stocks are trading below their 2008 highs, but so what? The same argument could have been made for the Nasdaq , but it did eventually test its old highs. Look at the chart below.

After the correction of 2003 ended the Nasdaq generally trended upward. Now you could have put on your bearish lens and moaned and groaned as it continued to trend higher and higher, interjecting along the way that the rally was not valid as it was trading well below its all-time high. If you took this path, pain and loss would have been your only friends. Or, you could have recognized it for the opportunity it was and jumped onboard.
